EXTRACTED VALUE: A great RPG for a next-gen system. It doesn't earn a perfect score because every element of Blue Dragon has been done time and time again.
Rainbow Six Vegas 2 isn’t the best sequel ever made, but it’s still a great tactical shooter in its own right.
A travesty. A mockery of the good name of Final Fantasy.
Time has not diminished Ikaruga's sublime shooting experience. This game still trumps other shooters with its unparalleled design and challenge.
Battlefield: Bad Company doesn't do everything, but what it does, it does right.
UT3 is an excellent addition to the Xbox 360 catalog, even though it lacks some features that were present in the PS3 version.
A solid game, and honestly one of the few launch titles that bring something new in terms of gameplay.
For something to tug on the heartstrings to the degree that Viva Pinata does is stunning. [Jan. 2007, p.97]
A lot has been done to improve the minor problems from the first game mainly the pinata intelligence and the general control of the game.
As a whole, however, Need for Speed: Most Wanted comes across as extremely polished and very fun.
Enormous US football sim that isn't as hard to get into as some of the previous versions. [Oct 2008, p.82]
A truly unique experience from start to finish, The Darkness is one of those games that will hook you in and steal your soul.
Shivering Isles adds more than enough new and interesting content to give you a great reason to dive back into the world of Oblivion.
A great mix of fun and frustration.
From every angle you take, Saints Row is golden. You’ll drive around and conquer Stilwater for hours to come and enjoy every minute of it.
